page.title: 13 Birnbeck pier
page.content: Birnbeck is an island which lays just off the coast in the north of Weston.super-Mare.Traditionally it was used as a fishing base.Nets were placed on stakes which were driven in at low tide.When the tide came in fish were caught.But when the tide went out again birds used to steal the fish,so two men were paid to stand on the island and frighten the birds away.The first pier between the shore and Birnbeck island was built of stone in the 1840's. But the pier was knocked down by strong currents. The present pier was opened on June 6th 1867. It was built of iron.Pavillions were built at the end from grey limestone. It is still very rare to find a pier which is built out to an island, as they usually just extend into the sea.
